newsitem.title: TANZANIA: 2,000 refugees from east Zaire reach Tanzania.
newsitem.headline: 2,000 refugees from east Zaire reach Tanzania.

text.p: Some 2,000 refugees fleeing fighting in eastern Zaire arrived in western Tanzania at the weekend on boats across Lake Tanganyika, the U.N. refugee agency said on Monday.
Vincent Parker, a spokesman for the U.N. High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR), said at least eight refugees had gunshot wounds and were taken to hospital in the Tanzanian lake port of Kigoma.
Parker said the refugees, mostly family members with their belongings, consisted of Zaireans and Burundian Hutus who had arrived on the lakeshore near Kigoma on 10 boats on Saturday.

He said there were no Zairean soldiers among the refugees. More than a million refugees and Zaireans are feared uprooted in eastern Zaire by two weeks of fighting between Zairean troops and Tusi rebels.
"If this trend continues, obviously it will be an emergency. Given the magnitude of the crisis in Zaire it is fair to expect the influx (into Tanzania) to continue," Parker warned.
There are about 41,000 Burundian Hutu refugees in Kigoma district and another 112,000 in Ngara district to the north.

Northwestern Tanzania also has camps housing 535,000 Rwandan Hutu refugees who fled their homeland during the genocide of up to a million Tutsis and Hutu moderates by Hutu troops, mobs and militiamen in 1994.
